Detailed Description

This is the sample OS Adaptation layer which is used by the GPMC driver. The OSAL layer can be ported in either of the following manners to a native OS:

Approach 1:
Use Prebuilt Libraries

  • Ensure that the provide an implementation of all Osal_XXX API for their native OS.
  • Link the prebuilt libraries with their application.
  • Refer to the "example" directory for an example of this
    Pros:
  • Customers can reuse prebuilt TI provided libraries
    Cons:
  • Level of indirection in the API to get to the actual OS call

Approach 2:
Rebuilt Library

  • Create a copy of this file and modify it to directly inline the native OS calls
  • Rebuild the GPMC Driver library; ensure that the Include path points to the directory where the copy of this file has been provided.
  • Please refer to the "test" directory for an example of this
    Pros:
  • Optimizations can be done to remove the level of indirection
    Cons:
  • GPMC Libraries need to be rebuilt by the customer.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define GPMC_osalAssert (   expr)    (OSAL_Assert(expr))

Assert API. If expression is true then it will stay in the while loop.

Parameters
exprExpression which need to be evaluated.
#define GPMC_osalCreateBlockingLock (   count,
  params 
)    (SemaphoreP_create((count),(params)))

The macro is used by the GPMC driver to create a semaphore for each GPMC opened in blocking mode. Semaphores created should initially be created with a count of 0 i.e. unavailable.

Parameters
countInitial count of the semaphore. For binary semaphores, only values of 0 or 1 are valid.
paramsPointer to the instance configuration parameters. NULL denotes to use the default parameters (SemOSAL default parameters as noted in ::SemOSAL_Params.
Returns
A void* on success or a NULL on an error
#define GPMC_osalDeleteBlockingLock (   X)    (SemaphoreP_delete(X))

The macro is used by the GPMC driver to delete a previously created semaphore. This is called when a GPMC opened in blocking mode is being closed.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void SemOSAL_delete(void* semHandle)

Parameter
Semaphore Handle returned by the create semaphore

Return Value
Not Applicable

#define GPMC_osalHardwareIntDestruct (   X)    (HwiP_delete(X))

Function to deregister a interrupt.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    int HwiOSAL_deregisterInterrupt(void* hwiPtr)

Parameter
Interrupt handler

Return Value
status of operation

#define GPMC_osalHardwareIntDisable ( )    (HwiP_disable())

Function to disable interrupts to enter a critical region.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void Osal_GPMCHardwareIntDisable()

Parameter
Not Applicable

Return Value
Interrupt key

#define GPMC_osalHardwareIntrClear (   X)    (HwiP_clearInterrupt(X))

Function to clear specific hardware interrupt.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void GPMC_osalHardwareIntrClear(unsigned int intrNum)

Parameter

Return Value

Parameter

  Y 
)    (MuxIntcP_create((X), (Y)))

Function to Setup Interrupt Controller Mux.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

Parameter
Pointer to the instance configuration input parameters.

Parameter
Pointer to the instance configuration output parameters.

#define GPMC_osalPendLock (   X,
  Y 
)    (SemaphoreP_pend((X),(Y)))

The macro is used by the GPMC driver to pend on a semaphore This is called when an application tries to receive data on a blocking when there is no data available. Since all semaphores are initially created to be unavailable; this will cause the application to block.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void Osal_GPMCPendLock(void* semHandle)

Parameter
Semaphore Handle

Return Value
Not Applicable

#define GPMC_osalPostLock (   X)    (SemaphoreP_post(X))

The macro is used by the GPMC driver to post the semaphore The driver posts the semaphore once data is received on a specific.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void Osal_GPMCPostLock(void* semHandle)

Parameter
Semaphore Handle

Return Value
Not Applicable

#define GPMC_osalRegisterInterrupt (   X,
  Y,
  Z 
)    (HwiP_create((X),(Y),(Z)))

Function to register an interrupt.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    HwiP_Handle HwiP_create(X, Y, Z);

Parameter
Interrupt number

Parameter
hwiFxn entry function of the hardware interrupt

Parameter
params argument passed into the entry function

Return Value
Interrupt handle

#define GPMC_osalSemParamsInit (   params)    (SemaphoreP_Params_init(params))

Initialize params structure to default values.

The default parameters are:

  • mode: SemOSAL_Mode_COUNTING
  • name: NULL
Parameters
paramsPointer to the instance configuration parameters.
